intro: Pasaniopsis cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pasania, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, elliptical leaves with a pointed tip. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in cymes, and bloom during the warmer months. Pasaniopsis cuspidata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
